meanings.definition: Adjust or mark (a measuring instrument) so that it can be used in a precise way.
meanings.sent1: He calibrates the thermometer to ensure accurate readings.
meanings.sent2: The technician calibrates the scale before weighing the ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly calibrates the clock to run backwards.
meanings.sent4: She calibrates her guitar strings to produce the perfect sound.
meanings.sent5: Calibrates your compass before heading into the woods to avoid getting lost.

meanings.definition: Make fine adjustments or divide into marked intervals for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic calibrates the engine for optimal performance.
meanings.sent2: It is important to calibrate the microscope before conducting experiments.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully calibrates the recipe to add a unique twist.
meanings.sent4: His training calibrates his mind to think critically in challenging situations.
meanings.sent5: Calibrates your focus to achieve your goals effectively.
